messages.no-codes-before-clsf-selected: No codes if no classification selected

coding-view.alert-description: Specify the language of the occupation/economic activity entry, the classification against which the entry will be coded and the desired level of prediction(s). The level input usually corresponds to the number of digits in a classificaiton code. Any arbitrary textual description can be entered in the last field which is coded.
coding-view.level-info: Not available if no classification selected
coding-view.feedback-alert-description: If possible, please specify below if the predicted code/title corresponds to the coded text.
coding-view.codes-select: Please specify which code/title matches best the coded text
coding-view.german-compound-words-dscr: Veuillez éviter d'utiliser des mots composés en allemand (par exemple, au lieu de 'Universitätsprofessor', utilisez 'Professor an der Universität')

recoding-view.alert-description: Specify an starting and a target classification to perform a recoding (or transcoding) between them. The result may include one or more outcomes ordered by their likelihood.
recoding-view.classification-2-crosswalk: No crosswalks defined from the selected starting classification

coding-drawer.title: Coding file data
coding-drawer.info: Specify the classification against which the coding will be executed and a desired code level.

recoding-drawer.title: Recoding file data
recoding-drawer.info: Specify the classifications between which the recoding will be performed. It is also required to specify which column of the file contains the starting codes.

about-modal.text: Procode is a tool that supports automatic (re-) coding of occupations and economic sectors against and between different classifications. The tool's algorithm implements a machine learning alogirithm and a large dataset of previous codings.
about-modal.contact-text: In case of misfunctioning or technical related question, please contact:

modify-modal.title: Modify prediction
modify-modal.info: Specify which code/title best match coded text. Your input will be added to our training dataset for further predictions.
modify-modal.codes-select: Select a code from the entire list of codes defined for this classification
